title: Past Tense - Regular Verbs
explanation:
The past tense (imperfectum) is used to tell what happened in the past. For regular verbs, there are two patterns:

1. Verbs ending in -de (soft consonants: v, z, l, m, n, r)
2. Verbs ending in -te (hard consonants: p, t, k, f, s, ch)

Memory aid: "'t kofschip" for hard consonants (t, k, f, s, ch, p)

Conjugations:
• ik/jij/hij/zij: stem + de/te
• wij/jullie/zij: stem + den/ten
keyPoints: Two patterns: -de or -te depending on last letter of stem
All persons have same ending (except plural)

examples.breakdown: speel + de (l is soft → not in 't kofschip)
woon + de (n is soft → not in 't kofschip)

exercises.question: Past tense of 'maken': Ik ... gisteren een taart.
exercises.explanation: Maak + te (k is hard according to 't kofschip)
exercises.hint: Is the k hard or soft? Think of 't kofschip

exercises.question: Past tense of 'wonen': Hij ... in Berlijn.
exercises.explanation: Woon + de (n is soft, not in 't kofschip)
exercises.hint: Is the n hard or soft?

exercises.question: Past tense of 'werken': Wij ... hard.
exercises.hint: K is hard, and it's plural

exercises.question: Past tense of 'spelen': Zij ... voetbal.
exercises.hint: L is soft, and it's plural

exercises.question: Past tense of 'koken': Ik ... pasta.
exercises.explanation: Kook + te (k is hard according to 't kofschip)
exercises.hint: Is the k hard or soft?

exercises.question: Past tense of 'luisteren': Jullie ... naar de radio.
exercises.hint: R is soft, and it's plural

exercises.question: Past tense of 'studeren': Hij ... Nederlands.
exercises.explanation: Studeer + de (r is soft, not in 't kofschip)
exercises.hint: Is the r hard or soft?

exercises.question: Past tense of 'maken': Zij ... een fout.
exercises.explanation: Maak + te (k is hard according to 't kofschip)

exercises.question: Past tense of 'wonen': Wij ... in Rotterdam.
exercises.hint: N is soft, and it's plural

exercises.question: Past tense of 'werken': Jullie ... samen.
exercises.hint: K is hard, and it's plural

commonMistakes.explanation: K is hard ('t kofschip) so use -te, not -de
N is soft (not in 't kofschip) so use -de
K is hard, and plural needs -ten
L is soft (not in 't kofschip) so use -de
K is hard, and plural needs -ten

tips: Practice with the stem: remove -en and look at the last letter
Common hard consonants: p, t, k, f, s, ch
Common soft consonants: v, z, l, m, n, r
